pr_title: Send data to trace agent when no API key is given

timeline.bodyText: Thanks for fixing all the typos! :)
timeline.author: mar-kolya
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -128,7 +128,7 @@ public ProfileUploader(final Config config) {
     * PID (see PidHelper for details),
     * Profiler version
     Since Config returns unmodifiable map we have to do copy here.
-    Ideally we should improve this logic and avoid copy, but performace impact is very limtied
+    Ideally we should improve this logic and avoid copy, but performance impact is very limited

timeline.bodyText: You probably would want to return profilingUrl if it was configured... in fact regardless of apiKey status if user forced profilingUrl that is probably what should be used.
timeline.author: mar-kolya

timeline.bodyText: I think there is logic that disables profiling completely if there is no key...
timeline.author: mar-kolya

replies.bodyText:
I searched the code for apiKey and did some random browsing but I couldn't find where we do this, I only found the api key being set in config depending on files being present and some test configuration.
I haven't checked the test suites yet and I've not deployed to my devenv without a key yet, I assume that will show me what the existing behaviour is 😄
replies.author: cimi

timeline.bodyText: Tests should be updated for these changes
timeline.author: mar-kolya

replies.bodyText:
I've removed the container id changes from here and I've added a test for computing the URL when no API key is present.
The only change missing a test in this PR is checking that when we don't have an API key, no API key header is added to the http request - I thought it's trivial, but I'm happy to add it if you disagree.
replies.author: cimi

timeline.bodyText: Do we have to do copy-pasting?
timeline.author: mar-kolya

replies.bodyText: Also, it seems to me that container-related stuff can go in separate PR just to simplify review
replies.author: mar-kolya

replies.bodyText: Seems like easiest solution here would be to move ContainerInfo to new package in utils and use it from there in both places. @tylerbenson any objections to this?
replies.author: mar-kolya

replies.bodyText: 👍 I'll open another PR for the container ID changes.
replies.author: cimi

timeline.bodyText: Nit: Given that this will become the default, I'm not sure this log line is very useful
timeline.author: AlexJF

timeline.bodyText:
Can we add a helpful message in case we're hitting the agent and the response is 404?
Like dd-trace-go is doing here: https://github.com/DataDog/dd-trace-go/blob/v1/profiler/upload.go#L113
Which looks like this in logs:
2020/06/11 10:06:21 Datadog Tracer v1.25.0 ERROR: Failed to upload profile: Datadog Agent is not accepting profiles. Agent-based profiling deployments require Datadog Agent >= 7.20
timeline.author: AlexJF
